data.title: inclusive Honeymoon Resorts
data.meta_description: Leave your worries behind and fall head over heels for these romantic all-inclusive honeymoon resorts.
data.text:
All-inclusive resorts typify easy, breezy vacation vibes. Having access to delicious food, top-shelf spirits and wine, extensive amenities, and loads of activities all without having to remember your wallet makes for a stress-free getaway.

Of course, there are many types of all-inclusive resorts around the world. Since couples who want to kick off matrimonial bliss with a carefree honeymoon full of romance, gorgeous scenery, and candle-lit dinners could definitely do without kiddos splashing in the pool and screaming at the buffet, we've skipped over all-inclusive resorts that cater to families. And hard-partying spring breakers won't be occupying the room next door either. The places on our list are very much honeymoon havens that guarantee your first trip as newlyweds will be a walk in the park (or a stroll on an empty white-sand beach, or a trek through a game reserve, or maybe even an amble along a forested pathway).

Here are 19 of the best all-inclusive honeymoon resorts for your romantic getaway.

Moskito Island, British Virgin Islands

Moskito Island — where Paris Hilton spent her honeymoon — is an unspoiled, exclusive private island. There are three enormous, free-standing, contemporary estates with multiple bedrooms (buddymoon, anyone?), private chefs, huge pools, and panoramic views, plus all the fun vacation stuff you'd expect like snorkeling, kayaking, sailing, and frolicking on white-sand beaches.

Jumby Bay Island, Antigua

Celebs like Justin Bieber and Paul McCartney (who can afford the best of everything) spend their holidays holed up on Jumby Bay Island, a 300-acre luxury resort and part of the Oetker Collection. The resort trades stress for sunshine, piña coladas, oceanfront accommodations, tennis, water sports, powdery beaches, and attentive service. While it is also one of the best all-inclusive resorts for families, it's ideal for honeymooners who want the full A-list experience.

Mahali Mzuri, Olare Motorogi Conservancy, Kenya

Basically, anything and everything Sir Richard Branson touches turns to gold, so why would his 12-tent luxury safari camp in the Kenyan Bush be any different? Mahali Mzuri gives adventure-loving honeymooners unfettered access to incredible wildlife. The ultimate way to end a day of game viewing? Sundowner cocktails and gourmet pan-African dishes (all included in the rate, of course).

The Brando, French Polynesia

Set on the private island of Tetiaroa, The Brando boasts fabulous villas with movie rooms, outdoor tubs, and plunge pools that entice couples to stay put the entire time. This exclusive French Polynesia paradise also has a beautiful white-sand beach and exciting activities like snorkeling the lagoon and coral gardens.

Four Seasons Tented Camp Golden Triangle, Thailand

A trip to the Four Seasons Tented Camp Golden Triangle is like being transported to a far-flung Eden of lush jungle and once-in-a-lifetime experiences. Honeymooners select bespoke packages, which cover everything from gourmet meals and handcrafted cocktails to Thai spa treatments, interacting with rescued elephants, and sleeping in luxury tents with outdoor showers.

The Palms, Tanzania

A honeymoon at The Palms, Zanzibar means five-star service, privacy, romance, and pretty island scenery to glance at while canoodling in one of the seven secluded villas, gazing into each other's eyes across the table at dinner, strolling hand in hand along the palm-fringed beaches, and splashing in the turquoise tides. Honeymooners will delight in bespoke activities like sundowners on the beach at sunset, a private dinner by lantern light on the beach, couples kayaking, windsurfing for two, his and hers spa sessions, and private tours of local palaces and emporiums.

Twin Farms, Vermont

Bucolic beauty and refined luxury define Twin Farms, a Relais & Chateaux property that's nestled on 300 acres of meadows, forested trails, rolling hills, and a pond that's prime for canoeing. Cozy accommodations and elevated, tastebud-tantalizing culinary experiences (read: the exact opposite of the food and beverage offerings at big, buffet-style all-inclusives) are two more reasons to fall in love. Indulge in gourmet picnics or mingle at the evening’s cocktails and canapés before heading back to your room decorated with paintings by David Hockney, Cy Twombly, and Jasper Johns. You can also take one of the resort’s Volvos for a drive through the Vermont countryside as pretty as the pictures on your room’s walls.

Jade Mountain Resort, St. Lucia

Jade Mountain Resort has long been considered the premier honeymoon spot on St. Lucia. Couples come for the romantic atmosphere and sanctuaries with private, mosaic-tiled infinity pools and views of the UNESCO-listed Pitons but stay (or maybe even extend the trip) for the in-suite massages and cuisine prepared by a James Beard Award-winning chef. Couples can go on hot springs, snorkeling, or sailing trips, as well as book couples spa treatments or private dinners for two on the Celestial Terrace. The Total Romance Package provides guests with a certificate for $500 which can be used on the next visit, meaning your first anniversary will be just as special.

Blackberry Farm, Tennessee

A country retreat that doesn't lack in luxury. Tucked away on a 4,200-acre estate in the Great Smoky Mountains, Blackberry Farm is an award-winning, small five-star hotel that's fabled for its breathtaking beauty, pastoral experiences, cozy cottages with romantic touches like outdoor fireplaces, and signature foothills cuisine. The 68 guest rooms are decorated with fine antiques and stocked with snacks for your comfort.

The Green O, Montana

There's something really romantic about the West. Especially when the rugged scenery and adventure activities such as cattle drives and ATV rides go hand in hand with multicourse tasting menus and snoozing in standalone tree houses. That's the dreamy deal at The Green O, an adults-only refuge in western Montana that has couples swooning. You’ll be provided use of a Lexus SUV, three meals per night, and in-room snacks.

Hermitage Bay, Antigua

Hermitage Bay is a peaceful and picturesque adults-only resort in Antigua that very much caters to honeymooners as well as couples looking for a quiet, romantic escape. It's a sublime spot to post up in a luxury suite, indulge in spa treatments, savor fine dining, and fall deeper in love with each other in a stunning and secluded setting.

Miraval Arizona Resort and Spa, Arizona

It's no secret that wedding planning can be stressful. That's why many newlyweds in need of R&R choose to unwind and let all that tension melt away with massages, sound baths, yoga, peaceful walks through the Sonoran desert, and plenty of cuddly robe time in the casita-style villas at wellness-focused all-inclusive Miraval Arizona Resort & Spa in Tucson.

Coco Plum Island Resort, Belize

Located off the coast of southern Belize, locally owned and managed adults-only Coco Plum Island Resort stands out as one of the dreamiest all-inclusives for a relaxing honeymoon. The vibe is lovely and laid-back. While kayaking, floating in the calm water, and falling asleep to the sounds of nature in an ocean-front cabana, you won't have a care in the world.

Necker Island, British Virgin Islands

A Caribbean honeymoon is great. But you know what's even better? A 74-acre, all-inclusive private island in the British Virgin Islands. Necker Island combines unblemished, postcard-worthy beauty, posh villas with plunge pools and ocean views, and all the snorkeling, kite surfing, sailing, tennis, yoga, and spa sessions you desire.

VOMO Island, Fiji

VOMO Island Fiji is a private island resort and honeymoon hideaway in the South Pacific. A lot of places claim to represent "barefoot luxury," but this 225-acre slice of paradise actually perfected it with swish villas, personalized service, ocean-side dining, bespoke experiences like private picnics in secluded coves, and an adults-only chill zone with poolside cabanas.

Emerald Maldives Resort and Spa

With 60 beach villas and 60 overwater villas, Emerald Maldives Resort and Spa makes for a luxurious honeymoon destination. With a dedicated water sports center, spa, and delectable dishes at four different restaurants (each with their own international flavor), couples may never want to leave this secluded resort in the Raa Atoll in the Maldives.

Le Blanc Spa Resort Los Cabos, Mexico

Newlyweds will find an adults-only, all-inclusive wonderland on the picturesque shores of Los Cabos at Le Blanc Spa Resort. Between personal butler service, 24-hour in-room dining, and bespoke experiences like sunset sailing and luxury yacht rides, it’s hard to choose just one high point at this resort. However, couples may be especially partial to the private spa suites where honeymooners can relax and recharge together with couples massages and the resort’s signature hydrotherapy.

"Le Blanc changed what I thought of Cancun all-inclusive resorts," said T+L editorial director Nina Ruggiero after a 2021 stay. "The dining felt elevated, the spa felt luxurious, and my room came with a private ocean-view jacuzzi. It's adult-only, and while the swim-up cocktail bar has a bit of a party vibe, it's overall serene compared to most Cancun scenes."

Fowl Cay, Bahamas

Fowl Cay provides a stunning private island backdrop to one of your most special vacations. After a day of riding around Exuma in your own personal powerboat (unlimited gas included), park at one of the six, fully-stocked villas you’ll call home for the week. White sand beaches, sailboats, fishing gear, kayaks, a freshwater pool, and inclusive meals and cocktails at the resort’s restaurant mean every detail is covered and all you have to focus on is each other. "This peaceful private island is the perfect example of barefoot luxury — and offers easy access to the Exumas' famous swimming pigs and countless other adventures by water" reported T+L editorial director Nina Ruggiero after a stay in 2017.

Royal Davui Island Resort, Fiji
